verses.verse: (Ps. 97:12) Sing praise to the LORD, you saints of His, And give thanks at the remembrance of His holy name.
For (Ps. 103:9; Is. 26:20; 54:7, 8) His anger is but for a moment, (Ps. 63:3) His favor is for life; Weeping may endure for a night, But joy comes in the morning.
Now in my prosperity I said, “I shall never be moved.”
LORD, by Your favor You have made my mountain stand strong; ((Deut. 31:17; Ps. 104:29; 143:7)) You hid Your face, and I was troubled.
I cried out to You, O LORD; And to the LORD I made supplication:
“What profit is there in my blood, When I go down to the pit? ((Ps. 6:5)) Will the dust praise You? Will it declare Your truth?
Hear, O LORD, and have mercy on me; LORD, be my helper!”
(Eccl. 3:4; Is. 61:3; Jer. 31:4) You have turned for me my mourning into dancing; You have put off my sackcloth and clothed me with gladness,
To the end that my glory may sing praise to You and not be silent. O LORD my God, I will give thanks to You forever.
The LORD a Fortress in Adversity To the Chief Musician. A Psalm of David. [1] In (Ps. 22:5) You, O LORD, I put my trust; Let me never be ashamed; Deliver me in Your righteousness.
(Ps. 17:6; 71:2; 86:1; 102:2) Bow down Your ear to me, Deliver me speedily; Be my rock of refuge, A fortress of defense to save me.
((Ps. 18:2)) For You are my rock and my fortress; Therefore, (Ps. 23:3; 25:11) for Your name’s sake, Lead me and guide me.
Pull me out of the net which they have secretly laid for me, For You are my strength.
(Luke 23:46) Into Your hand I commit my spirit; You have redeemed me, O LORD God of ((Deut. 32:4); Ps. 71:22) truth.
I have hated those (Jon. 2:8) who regard useless idols; But I trust in the LORD.
I will be glad and rejoice in Your mercy, For You have considered my trouble; You have ((John 10:27)) known my soul in adversities,
And have not ((Deut. 32:30); Ps. 37:33) shut me up into the hand of the enemy; ((Ps. 4:1; 18:19)) You have set my feet in a wide place.
Have mercy on me, O LORD, for I am in trouble; (Ps. 6:7) My eye wastes away with grief, Yes, my soul and my body!
For my life is spent with grief, And my years with sighing; My strength fails because of my iniquity, And my bones waste away.

((Is. 53:4)) I am a reproach among all my enemies, But (Job 19:13; Ps. 38:11; 88:8, 18) especially among my neighbors, And am repulsive to my acquaintances; (Ps. 64:8) Those who see me outside flee from me.
(Ps. 88:4, 5) I am forgotten like a dead man, out of mind; I am like a broken vessel.
(Ps. 50:20; Jer. 20:10) For I hear the slander of many; (Lam. 2:22) Fear is on every side; While they (Ps. 62:4; Matt. 27:1) take counsel together against me, They scheme to take away my life.
But as for me, I trust in You, O LORD; I say, “You are my God.”
My times are in Your ((Job 14:5; 24:1)) hand; Deliver me from the hand of my enemies, And from those who persecute me.
